intro: Muraltia confusa, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree that can grow up to 10 meters tall. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by red, fleshy berries. Its leaves are elliptical, glossy, and arranged alternately along the stems. The species is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been introduced to other regions, though it can become invasive in some areas.
